title: Davening | Mekor 3
headings: Mondays, Thursdays, Rosh Chodesh, and Fast Days (days that Torah is read):
Interested in reading Torah or Haftorah, or leading davening? Have an upcoming yahrzeit?
text: Skip to Main Content Membership Events Donate Kiddush Center City Beit Midrash Join Us Davening Who We Are Kosher Restaurants More Support Mekor Davening Shabbat Services Friday Evening Mincha/Kabbalat Shabbat & Ma'ariv Summer: 7:00 PM Winter: Approx. at Candle Lighting Time. It is preferred that you RSVP by Friday afternoon by emailing admin@mekorhabracha.org. However, an RSVP is not required, and you can safely assume there will be a minyan even if you arrive without having RSVP’d. Mincha/Kabbalat Shabbat/Ma'ariv - see weekly schedule; generally 7 PM in the summer, 15 minutes before sunset otherwise RSVP by afternoon on Friday to mekorhabracha@gmail.com. Shabbat Morning - 9:15 AM Shacharit: 9:15 AM followed by a delicious hot Kiddush at approx. 11:30 AM Mincha/Kabbalat Shabbat/Ma'ariv - see weekly schedule; generally 7 PM in the summer, 15 minutes before sunset otherwise RSVP by afternoon on Friday to mekorhabracha@gmail.com. Shabbat Afternoon Shabbat Class Approx. 30 minutes before Mincha (Summer Only) Mincha/Kabbalat Shabbat/Ma'ariv - see weekly schedule; generally 7 PM in the summer, 15 minutes before sunset otherwise RSVP by afternoon on Friday to mekorhabracha@gmail.com. Mincha, followed by 3rd meal: Approximately 30 min before sundown Mincha/Kabbalat Shabbat/Ma'ariv - see weekly schedule; generally 7 PM in the summer, 15 minutes before sunset otherwise RSVP by afternoon on Friday to mekorhabracha@gmail.com. Early Mincha: (Winter Only)​ 12:20 PM (immediately following Kiddush). Early Mincha is in addition to the mincha that is 30 min before sundown. Mincha/Kabbalat Shabbat/Ma'ariv - see weekly schedule; generally 7 PM in the summer, 15 minutes before sunset otherwise RSVP by afternoon on Friday to mekorhabracha@gmail.com. Mondays, Thursdays, Rosh Chodesh, and Fast Days (days that Torah is read): 6:45 AM Mincha/Kabbalat Shabbat/Ma'ariv - see weekly schedule; generally 7 PM in the summer, 15 minutes before sunset otherwise RSVP by afternoon on Friday to mekorhabracha@gmail.com. Tuesdays, Wednesdays, & Fridays: 6:55 AM Mincha/Kabbalat Shabbat/Ma'ariv - see weekly schedule; generally 7 PM in the summer, 15 minutes before sunset otherwise RSVP by afternoon on Friday to mekorhabracha@gmail.com. Major Secular Holidays: 8:30 AM 6:45 AM Mincha/Kabbalat Shabbat/Ma'ariv - see weekly schedule; generally 7 PM in the summer, 15 minutes before sunset otherwise RSVP by afternoon on Friday to mekorhabracha@gmail.com. Mincha / Maariv* Summer: Mincha followed by Maariv: Approximately 15 minutes before sunset (at zman) Mincha/Kabbalat Shabbat/Ma'ariv - see weekly schedule; generally 7 PM in the summer, 15 minutes before sunset otherwise RSVP by afternoon on Friday to mekorhabracha@gmail.com. Winter: Maariv (only) 6:30 PM Mincha/Kabbalat Shabbat/Ma'ariv - see weekly schedule; generally 7 PM in the summer, 15 minutes before sunset otherwise RSVP by afternoon on Friday to mekorhabracha@gmail.com. *At this time, weekday Mincha and Maariv will only be held if there is sufficient interest. ​​Additional note: Weekday morning and evening services are followed by a brief halachic insight from Rabbi Hirsch or Rabbi Gotlib. Amud Yomi class follows most morning services. ​​ Other nearby weekday minyanim (please call for confirmation): ​​ Orthodox Community at Penn (University of Pennsylvania Hillel). Find the schedule HERE. Mikveh Israel Synagogue Bnai Abraham Chabad 1818 Market Street (ground floor) and Mikveh Israel has a 2pm daily mincha M-Th. ​​ Suburban locations: Lower Merion Synagogue Young Israel of the Mainline ​​​​ Weekday services Shacharit Sundays: 8:30 AM followed by BLT (Bagels, Lox, and Torah!) Mincha/Kabbalat Shabbat/Ma'ariv - see weekly schedule; generally 7 PM in the summer, 15 minutes before sunset otherwise RSVP by afternoon on Friday to mekorhabracha@gmail.com. PLEASE NOTE: If you're interested in participating in the weekday morning or evening minyan, kindly email admin@mekorhabracha.org and specify the day(s) you're signing up for. We will send you an email confirmation if the minyan will take place. You can now also click on the Whats App community link in the main menu of this site or click here to join the minyan group and stay up to date on everything! On occasion, you may find the building door locked. If so, please call the shul (215-525-4246) and leave a message to gain access, or just wait by the door for one of our members to arrive with a building key. Let us know! Get Started for Free Interested in reading Torah or Haftorah, or leading davening? Have an upcoming yahrzeit? First Name Email Last Name Phone Additional Note Submit Mekor Habracha Center City Synagogue (215) 525-4246 admin@mekorhabracha.org ​ 1500 Walnut St Suite 206 Philadelphia, PA 19102 SUBSCRIBE TO OUR WEEKLY NEWSLETTER Enter your email here SUBSCRIBE Latest Newsletters Copyright ©2025 by Mekor Habracha Synagogue

    Support Mekor

    Davening

    Shabbat Services

    Friday Evening

    Mincha/Kabbalat
    Shabbat & Ma'ariv

    Summer: 7:00 PM

    Winter: Approx. at Candle Lighting Time.

    It is preferred that you RSVP by Friday afternoon by emailing admin@mekorhabracha.org. However, an RSVP is not required, and you can safely assume there will be a minyan even if you arrive without having RSVP’d.

      Mincha/Kabbalat Shabbat/Ma'ariv - see weekly schedule; generally 7 PM in the summer, 15 minutes before sunset otherwise
       RSVP by afternoon on Friday to mekorhabracha@gmail.com.

    Shabbat Morning - 9:15 AM

    Shacharit: 

    9:15 AM followed by a delicious hot Kiddush at approx. 11:30 AM

      Mincha/Kabbalat Shabbat/Ma'ariv - see weekly schedule; generally 7 PM in the summer, 15 minutes before sunset otherwise
       RSVP by afternoon on Friday to mekorhabracha@gmail.com.

    Shabbat Afternoon

    Shabbat Class

    Approx. 30 minutes before Mincha (Summer Only) 

      Mincha/Kabbalat Shabbat/Ma'ariv - see weekly schedule; generally 7 PM in the summer, 15 minutes before sunset otherwise
       RSVP by afternoon on Friday to mekorhabracha@gmail.com.

    Mincha, followed
    by 3rd meal:

    Approximately 30 min before sundown

      Mincha/Kabbalat Shabbat/Ma'ariv - see weekly schedule; generally 7 PM in the summer, 15 minutes before sunset otherwise
       RSVP by afternoon on Friday to mekorhabracha@gmail.com.

    Early Mincha:
    (Winter Only)​

    12:20 PM (immediately following Kiddush). Early Mincha is in addition to the mincha that is 30 min before sundown.

      Mincha/Kabbalat Shabbat/Ma'ariv - see weekly schedule; generally 7 PM in the summer, 15 minutes before sunset otherwise
       RSVP by afternoon on Friday to mekorhabracha@gmail.com.

    Mondays, Thursdays, Rosh Chodesh, and Fast Days (days that Torah is read):

    6:45 AM

      Mincha/Kabbalat Shabbat/Ma'ariv - see weekly schedule; generally 7 PM in the summer, 15 minutes before sunset otherwise
       RSVP by afternoon on Friday to mekorhabracha@gmail.com.

    Tuesdays, Wednesdays, & Fridays:

     6:55 AM

      Mincha/Kabbalat Shabbat/Ma'ariv - see weekly schedule; generally 7 PM in the summer, 15 minutes before sunset otherwise
       RSVP by afternoon on Friday to mekorhabracha@gmail.com.

    Major Secular Holidays:

    8:30 AM

    6:45 AM

      Mincha/Kabbalat Shabbat/Ma'ariv - see weekly schedule; generally 7 PM in the summer, 15 minutes before sunset otherwise
       RSVP by afternoon on Friday to mekorhabracha@gmail.com.

    Mincha / Maariv*

    Summer: Mincha followed by Maariv:

    Approximately 15 minutes before sunset (at zman)

      Mincha/Kabbalat Shabbat/Ma'ariv - see weekly schedule; generally 7 PM in the summer, 15 minutes before sunset otherwise
       RSVP by afternoon on Friday to mekorhabracha@gmail.com.

    Winter: Maariv (only)

    6:30 PM

      Mincha/Kabbalat Shabbat/Ma'ariv - see weekly schedule; generally 7 PM in the summer, 15 minutes before sunset otherwise
       RSVP by afternoon on Friday to mekorhabracha@gmail.com.

     *At this time, weekday Mincha and Maariv will only be held if there is sufficient interest.

    ​​Additional note: Weekday morning and evening services are followed by a brief halachic insight from Rabbi Hirsch or Rabbi Gotlib. Amud Yomi class follows most morning services.

    ​​

    Other nearby weekday minyanim (please call for confirmation):  

    ​​

    • Orthodox Community at Penn (University of Pennsylvania Hillel).  Find the schedule HERE.

    • Mikveh Israel Synagogue 

    • Bnai Abraham Chabad  

    • 1818 Market Street (ground floor) and Mikveh Israel has a 2pm daily mincha M-Th.

    ​​

    Suburban locations:

    • Lower Merion Synagogue 

    • Young Israel of the Mainline ​​​​

    Weekday services

    Shacharit

    Sundays: 

    8:30 AM followed by BLT (Bagels, Lox, and Torah!)

      Mincha/Kabbalat Shabbat/Ma'ariv - see weekly schedule; generally 7 PM in the summer, 15 minutes before sunset otherwise
       RSVP by afternoon on Friday to mekorhabracha@gmail.com.

    PLEASE NOTE: If you're interested in participating in the weekday morning or evening minyan, kindly email admin@mekorhabracha.org and specify the day(s) you're signing up for. We will send you an email confirmation if the minyan will take place. You can now also click on the Whats App community link in the main menu of this site or click here to join the minyan group and stay up to date on everything!

     

    On occasion, you may find the building door locked. If so, please call the shul (215-525-4246) and leave a message to gain access, or just wait by the door for one of our members to arrive with a building key.

    Let us know!
